means: 用钱，花钱( spend的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The government is spending billions of dollars on new urban rail projects.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府正把数十亿元花在新城市铁路项目上。

sentence.Network_en: Keep your spending on luxuries down to manageable proportions.
sentence.Network_cn: 将你在奢侈品上的花费降至可控范围。

sentence.Network_en: He's a staunch supporter of controls on government spending.
sentence.Network_cn: 他坚决支持控制政府开支。

entry.def: When you spend money, you pay money for things that you want.

example.ex: By the end of the holiday I had spent all my money...
example.tran: 到假期结束时，我已经花光了自己所有的钱。

example.ex: Businessmen spend enormous amounts advertising their products...
example.tran: 商人们花费巨额资金为自己的商品做广告。

entry.def: If you spend time or energy doing something, you use your time or effort doing it.

example.ex: Engineers spend much time and energy developing brilliant solutions...
example.tran: 工程师们花费很多时间和精力来开发完美的解决方案。

example.ex: This energy could be much better spent taking some positive action.
example.tran: 这些精力若用于采取某些积极行动的话，可能会更值得。

entry.def: If you spend a period of time in a place, you stay there for a period of time.

example.ex: We spent the night in a hotel.

entry.def: The spend on a particular thing is the amount of money that is spent on it, or will be spent.

means.word_mean: 1. the act of spending or disbursing money

auth_sentence.content: You can always improve safety by spending more money.

What eventually made Carla Toebe realize she was spending too much time on the Internet?
Those who are thinking their time did reverse spending time socializing instead of working.
They save up cash and desperately cut spending
Spending on such "durables" dropped at a 12% annual rate in 2008's third quarter, a 20% rate in the fourth.

sentences.en: Spending has decreased slightly this year.
